extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 1 bunch arugula (1/4 pound), thick stems discarded

extendedIngredients.name: garlic cloves
extendedIngredients.original: 5 garlic cloves, 4 thinly sliced and 1 minced
extendedIngredients.originalName: garlic cloves, 4 thinly sliced and 1 minced

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: serrano ham
extendedIngredients.original: 2 ounces thinly sliced Serrano ham or prosciutto, cut into 1/2-inch-wide strips
extendedIngredients.originalName: thinly sliced Serrano ham or prosciutto, cut into 1/2-inch-wide strips

title: Lentil Soup with Serrano Ham and Arugula
summary: Lentil Soup with Serrano Ham and Arugulan is a gluten free and dairy free main course. One serving contains 317 calories, 17g of protein, and 11g of fat. This recipe serves 6 and costs $1.68 per serving. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. A mixture of lentils, salt and pepper, pepper, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 30 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 91%, this dish is great. Similar recipes are Grilled Pizza with Arugula Pesto, Corn, and Ham (VIDEO), Melon, Serrano Ham, and Arugula Salad, and Serrano Ham and Arugula Salad with Pomegranate Salsa.
instructions: In a large saucepan, cover the lentils with the water and bring to a boil.                                              Meanwhile, in a medium soup pot, heat 1/4 cup of the olive oil until shimmering. Add the onions, carrots, celery and sliced garlic. Cover and cook the vegetables over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until they are softened, 5 to 6 minutes. Carefully add the lentils and the boiling water. Add the tomato paste and 1/4 teaspoon of crushed red pepper to the soup and season with salt and black pepper. Cook the soup over moderate heat until the lentils are tender, about 20 minutes.                                               Meanwhile, in a small skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering. Add the minced garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the ham and a generous pinch of crushed red pepper to the skillet and cook for 30 seconds. Add the arugula and cook just until wilted, 30 seconds longer. Ladle the lentil soup into large bowls, garnish with the ham and arugula and serve.

steps.step: In a large saucepan, cover the lentils with the water and bring to a boil.
Meanwhile, in a medium soup pot, heat 1/4 cup of the olive oil until shimmering.

Add the onions, carrots, celery and sliced garlic. Cover and cook the vegetables over moderately high heat, stirring occasionally, until they are softened, 5 to 6 minutes. Carefully add the lentils and the boiling water.
Add the tomato paste and 1/4 teaspoon of crushed red pepper to the soup and season with salt and black pepper. Cook the soup over moderate heat until the lentils are tender, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering.
Add the minced garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add the ham and a generous pinch of crushed red pepper to the skillet and cook for 30 seconds.
Add the arugula and cook just until wilted, 30 seconds longer. Ladle the lentil soup into large bowls, garnish with the ham and arugula and serve.
